item.description:
4 basic arithmetic operations are exercised in this game.
Each player gets cards with a math problem. Whoever has solved all his problems first wins the game.

With this quiz game the players will learn everything that they always wanted to know about the world of good cooking. With this game another lifestyle trend arrives now in the world of boardgames. „Which is a class champagne? “, „who is a famous television cook in England? “, „are there also female star cooks?“. These are only some the 600 questions, which were developed together with German Star Cook Johann Lafer.
The map is a genuine porcelain plate of Villeroy & Boch.

name.value: Die kleinen Biber bauen einen Damm

item.description: Together all of the beavers try to save the dam from the rising water. They get logs out to the woods in order to repair the beaver dam. Only when the beavers are fast enough will they win against the water.

Each player tries to get his six markers from the bottom row no. 6 through the sand glass to the opposite row no. 6.
The player who reaches this opposite row first is the winner.

Children's game where they try and create a colored flower.
Three marbles, a bowl and lots of colored petals and the game can begin!
White, red, yellow or blue? Nobody knows what petal the marbles will land on.

Well hidden under the cup three marbles are rolling. For each marble that lands on a colored leaf, you get a petal of the same color.
The first one to collect six colored petals and thus creates a colored flower wins the game.
Each player tries to collect as many points as possible by good placements in the 5 downhill ski-races. The winner is the player who has achieved the highest score after the last race.

name.value: Mein erstes Naturspiel: Kennst Du den Baum?
Richesses de la nature: Je découvre les arbres

item.description: The players try to lay open the cards of a tree species and to get wood stones for this action. When all seven tree species in the row 1-5 lay open the game is over, and the player with the most wood stones wins.

A hungry shark is on his way to eat fish caught in the nets of the fishermen. The fishermen decide to work together and hunt this shark. The fisherman are strongest when 5 are in the same boat, so they have to plan how they can get 5 together. The Shark is caught when the 5 fishermen and the shark are together on a light blue field, then the fishermen have won. If the shark makes it to his cave then he has won.

The game is played in 5 rounds. Players take turns flipping over cards. When a banana card is flipped up, the active player gets a big banana. When a monkey is shown, the banana has to be put back. Banana peels mean there is no change. When all cards are face up the round is finished. The player who has the big banana at the end of the round gets a small banana. The player who has the most bananas at the end wins. 
The game is entirely luck-driven and targets the very young.

A trick-taking card game around Agent 006.
The players try to get as many tricks as possible. In the tricks there may be identity cards which can be traded in for agent equipment cards.
The players with 6 or more equipment cards wins the game.

The players discover an unknown island where goblins live. At the and of the island visit they get treasures from the goblins which have to be found around the island. The goblins however have fun trying to disturb the players during their search for the treasure.
The player who has found the most treasures is the winner.

During unloading of an airplane all suitcases on the plane have been dropped and opened. The contents of the suitcases got messed up. Everyone has since quickly filled the suitcases again, but what is inside my suitcase now? 
The game ends when all passengers have found their suitcases. The player with the highest score wins.
The players try to play a coup of Max & Moritz. Whoever succeeds in playing a coup may give away a chip. Whoever gets rid of his chips first wins the game.

Are you "wordy"? Then you will have fun with this fast and funny game. The game idea is to build words out of a "handful of characters". Short words or long words. The longest words let you move quickly forward to the finish line.

The trip starts on the moon and leads to a wild odyssey to the sun. With luck and some playing with numbers you are able to send back some space stations and with them skillfully move yourself forward. The winner is the player who reaches the pink star with the 6 on the sunbeam first.

Three different word games can be played with the material.
As an example the first game:
Playing Passt in jeden Koffer' (="fits in every suitcase") the game leader thinks about a word and puts the matching character cards in wrong order on the table. Each player tries to find the word first to get the attribute card.

With the Lettro - character cards you can play many popular games as Buchstaben-Memo for 2 to 5 players, or Alphabet-Training for 1 and more players,or Buchatebn-Quartett for 2 to4 players, Kreuzwort, ABC-Schnipp-Schnapp and finally Wörter-Poker.

From the One Page Wars game series.

"Welcome to your new farm! The land has been previously farmed pretty hard and it is your turn to make it profitable again."

Players take turns placing their markers, either on the mapsheet or on a strategy sheet (the latter invokes certain special results, such as increasing victory points for occupied hexes, or requiring markers to be removed from the board, etc.) Once both players have placed all twelve of their markers, the positions are scored to determine the winning farmer.

Each player plays the role of a magician who has to brew a magic potion. They need ingredients for it. The magicians walk through the forest to search for those ingredients. In some fields they find only one half of a ingredient and have to look for the other half. The winner is the player who accumulates all of the needed ingredients first.

From the One Page Wars game series.

An abstract, small-format "shoot-em-up" wargame with asymmetrical forces.

The mapsheet is a narrow corridor of irregularly shaped spaces made from overlapping hexes, some of which are marked as offering special defensive bonuses.

The black forces, which start at the south edge of the map, consist of three armor, three infantry, and three artillery units. The red player controls the northern half of the mapsheet, which holds the victory point hexes. The red forces consist of five infantry units and three artillery units.

All of the units are marked with two numbers. To prevail in combat, a unit must roll a result between these two numbers on 2d6. All units have the same movement rate, one space per turn.

Each player must try to get rid of his cards as fast as possible. That happens by laying out his cards in a maximum of 4 rows on the table or on the decks of opposing players Whoever lays down all his cards first is the winner and takes the camels.

We travel with Tiger and Bear through Panama, the land of their dreams. You smell bananas there, wherever you are. On their trip they meet a lot of friendly animals, go by raft and have to go across bridges in order to finally come back home happy . In order that no one dies of hunger everyone gets a cooking pot, anyone else goes fishing at the neighbor... Whoever returns back home first wins.

Each player gets a pawn which is moved by a die and cards with pictures of male birds. The cards of the female birds are put face down on the board 
The players try to find as many fitting cards with female birds as possible. The winner is the player with the most pairs of birds.

Hedgehogs are useful animals, but the fox is one of their natural enemies. They find shelter for themselves by rolling themselves together into a bowl.

A highway with cars is a dangerous place for them. On land without bushes and hedges they cannot hide themselves. The players must try to keep the hedgehogs out of danger. The player who finishes his tour around the board and back to the nest with hedgehogs first is the winner.

In the Indian village Pocahontas looks for friends Meeko and Flit. After she has found them she walks to Grandma Willow's where she gets help for her adventures. Together with Captain John Smith she walks across the rock and the river to the ship. They have to pass the malicious Governor Ratcliffe. Whoever reaches the ship first with Meeko, Flit and John Smith wins the game.

The game idea is to save the earth from suffocation in garbage. The players move over the board hitting fields with question cards and action cards. The right answers provide green chips. 3 chips can be traded in for a puzzle segment of nature that covers the garbage. Wrong answers and bad action cards provide black points which let the clock move towards the 12!
Is the landscape totally filled with nature puzzles the players have won.
The idea of BRAINY is to decode the secret three-line-pattern-code and to get as many chips as possible to win.
Each player tries to provide Santa Claus with a cap, coat, sack, pants and boots and to reach one of the red marked finish fields with one pawn.

Publishers description:

"Children of all ages will have fun challenging their spelling skills while playing The Great Word Race! You'll never believe spelling can be such a blast. Race your pawn from start to finish by moving it the number of letters in the word you build. Throw six dice with the letters of the alphabet. Add any Letter for Life cards you have collected. If you land on a Pick A Card square, use it! Should you collect Letter for Life cards, double your spaces, or Pick a Card and follow its instructions. Choose your strategy and race for the finish!"

For 2 to 4 players. Ages 6 and up.

The Darling Dash to Tuck Baby into Bed! It's beddy-bye time and it's up to you to collect a teddy bear,pajamas and bottle and tuck your baby into bed. Before you know it, your precious little bundle of joy will be all snuggled up and fast asleep!

Contents: Game board,48 playing cards,4 tokens with stands,1 rattle die,rules.

Several storm cells bear down on the town of Doomsville, Oklahoma (population 213). Each contains an F1 tornado that will grow in strength and carve its own path of destruction. Do what you have always wanted to... Take control of one of nature's most dangerous forces: the Tornado! Using your twister, destroy as much of the town of Doomsville and the surrounding countryside as you can - do a better job than the other players and win the game!

To win, you will need to properly control the path of the Tornado and manage its strength so that destroy high value buildings. Some buildings can only be destroyed by extremely strong F5 tornadoes, while others can be wiped out with only an F2. You will manage the strength and path using a pool of "storm points". Each player starts with the same amount, but as you use them to plan your actions, the pools for each tornado will change accordingly.

Doomsville rebuilds itself for each game; meaning that for each game there is a method for randomly building the town and the surrounding countryside. This makes each game play distinctly different and puts the tornadoes into a fight to get the higher value buildings before their opponents.

So what are you waiting for...? Get to wiping Doomsville off the map!

NOTE: This game was inspired a couple of months after a small twister (F0 probably) tore up some trees in my yard in July 2006 and discussing it with my son. Tornadoes are very dangerous and interesting facts and safety information about tornadoes will be included in the game.

Thomas has challenged James, Molly and Percy to a great race! Learn numbers as you earn coal to shovel into your engine and power it up and over the hill. Develop sorting, counting and color matching skills as you race to the finish.

Contents: Great race track (2 sections), track connector, 4 racing engines, 24 question cards, 30 coal blocks, game rules.

Description from products website:

“Set sail for the New World across uncharted waters,where unseen Sea Monsters are lurking below the waves. Navigate through typhoons, get blown off course and even drift out to sea. And just when you think your home free,a Sea Monster may appear out of nowhere to wreck your ship!”

Contents: 8 Sea Monsters/Wave Cards,12 Ships (4 colors),4 port of call cards,8 storm at sea cards, Seafarer's Die (Blue), Sea Monster's Die (Green),rules.

item.description:
Briarpatch website description:

Hang onto your shorts! Clothespins! Is the fast paced,strategy game where players score points by completing clotheslines of matching patterns or items of laundry. But watch out for the birds they may fly off with your boxers!

PIP- The Ultimate Domino Game. A Distinctively different domino game. Challenging fun for the entire family!

There's a challenge with every play! By using our unique Wild Tiles designs and Directional Tiles, we have combined traditional dominoes with a different theme to provide an exciting change of pace. Strategy and luck are also in play with each round as players compete to be the first to play their last remaining tile.

Double 9 domino game plus 11 wild Pips, and four directional tiles which cause skip, reverse, play again, and draw action. 70 Standard Size (1" x 2" x 3/8") tiles in vinyl, snap case, with wooden centerpiece. 2-6 players.

A board and card game designed to help develop library skills.

Contents:
 - gameboard
- game cards
- markers + guides
- poster

From Henderson (2003):

"This game is Monopoly-style game that incorporates knowledge of mosquito biology and control. It consists of 2 dice, 12 game pieces, 140 ‘Question and Answer’ cards, and 32 Life Cycle cards. As players answer questions correctly they move their game piece and attempt another question. An extensive glossary of terms with definitions is included."

Henderson, Julie Price. Annotated Bibliography: Mosquito Educational Tools for Children. Winnipeg: Natural Resources Institute, University of Manitoba, 2003.

Game description from the publisher:

Set Cubed is a curious game of clever connections, challenging a player's ability to identify SETs between the dice in their hand and those already on the board. Players can play up to 3 dice per turn making as many SETs as possible. Create SETs up, down and across the board, the more SETs you create, the higher your score. As the number of dice on the board increase so do the possible SET combinations. Rack up points by using BONUS SQUARES! Roll a WILD dice and unleash the possible number of SETs that can be made during your turn! How many SETs can you make?! The player with the most points wins!

item.description:
OBJECTIVE: 
Catch and bring in the highest total weight of fish.

GAME PLAY:
Draw a boat, choose your fishing "jigs" (rods) and lures, then set out to catch fish. You decide how far to travel (up to your boat's max speed) on each turn, but you have to slow down if you're in the weeds or in a dock zone.

Travel around the water "casting" and "flippin'" fish, and make sure you have the right jig for the type of water you're fishing. If you're "flippin'", you can get right up next to a fish, but if you're casting, you have to stay a few spaces away and roll the die to see if you've caught it. (Takes some initial strategy to make sure you have enough of the right jigs for the area you're planning to fish.)

And those fish are crafty - you might lose a rod or a lure or pull in a mermaid or old tire instead of a fish. And sometimes you have to throw one back.

Get back to your starting dock within 32 turns or start losing fish.

Includes rules for "Recreational" play and "Tournament" play.

GAME COMPONENTS:
1 Lake playing surface (board with small hexes)
6 boat cards
48 lure cards
36 "jig" cards (rod and reel)
12 sets of fish markers, of 5 types (two types have 3 sets, the rest have two)
6 Strategy statistic reference cards
1 six-sided die
6 colored plastic round boat markers
1 score pad
15 plastic re-usable bags

item.description:
Keltis is a multi-player game based on Lost Cities, with some rules changes, later published with Knizia's original rules and theme as Lost Cities: The Board Game.

Players play cards to move their playing pieces along stone paths. Cards show one of five different colors/symbols, each corresponding to one path; in addition, each card shows a number (0-10, twice each). In each color, each player can play his cards in either ascending or descending order. As in Lost Cities, it's better to concentrate on a few paths since the final spaces on a path grant high points, but ending early gives negative ones.

The active player plays one card (out of a hand of eight) or discards one, then moves the corresponding playing piece on the path. Many of the spaces have a token that grants some bonus: either immediate points (counted on the scoring track), an extra move on a path, or wishing stones that are needed at game end to avoid negative points.

The game ends when five playing pieces (from any combination of players) have reached the seventh (or higher) space on their respective paths. Now, scoring happens: 

 Pieces that moved only 1-3 steps earn negative points (-4, -3, -2).
 Pieces with 4+ steps earn points (1, 2, 3, 6, 7, 10). 
 One piece of each player twice the height of other pieces scores double, either positive or negative. 
 Holding fewer than two wish stones earns negative points (-3 / -4), while a collection of five or more stones yields a bonus of 10 points.




All endgame points are added to any scored during the game. The player with the highest score wins!


Primary differences between Lost Cities: The Board Game and Keltis:

1. In LCBG you play 3 rounds, scoring at the end of all 3 for the monuments you collect. (Normal scoring occurs each round.) In Keltis, you only play 1 round, and score everything each round. This is not just a rule difference, as the scoring is different for the monuments/stones based on the number collected.

2. In Keltis, you may play your cards in either order, high to low, or low to high. In LCBG, you must go low to high.

Note: the rules for LCBG have the Keltis rules as variants, and have the board elements necessary for #1 above. Keltis does not have the rules nor board elements to play LCBG.

There are more differences that are non-substantive. (Art, points in LCBG multiplied by 5, etc.)

item.description:
From the publisher's website:

A quick and skillful strategy game for two where players thread the two-tone cord back and forth through the holes of the hand held board until all adjoining hole options are filled. Maneuvering an opponent's cord end into a blocked position requires rational decision making and observation skills so make sure you're not the one getting strung along!

From the publisher's website bigboardraiders.net :

I do not have any affiliation with any investment entity and I am not encouraging anyone to invest in anything. This is intended for your entertainment and learning.

I think we all know young boys or girls who seem like they were hard-wired for finance. When the subject of money is being discussed, they are right there like spounges soaking it up. I know because I was one of them, but my parents didn't take the time to teach me about money. Today lots of parents still don't teach their kids enough about money, and yet our kids will all deal with money most days in their lives and how early they begin to understand money, will directly influence their lifestyle. This game is for parents to encourage those little finance prodigies. The world is changing to where the cash in your hand is the crumbs from the table, while the banquet is inside the corporations. For Grade 5 and up, but best for teens and up.

The “Big Board” is like a nickname for Wall Street, while “Raiders” are the teams of entrepreneurs, lawyers, accountants, brokers and investment bankers who engaged in hostile takeovers of the companies they pursue. In Big Board Raiders, players can gang-up by pooling their capital to promote a cause or stop another player, but alliances don’t last forever and when they end, backstabbing is an inevitable strategy. Communication and deal making are very important enhancements to a player’s game strategy. A few choice words can help your portfolio or have the opposite effect on your opponent’s. It’s all about opportunities, timing and the hustle.

There are two main objectives players engage in while playing Big Board Raiders; the first is to get elected by proxy as a director of a company and the second is to grow your portfolio using the many investment vehicles, so that you will have the capital to make your move to control your company; the company in which you were elected to the board by proxy. There are four trading companies: Yellow, Blue, Red, and Green. Six Subsidiaries, and each of these subsidiaries has a proxy vote that it gives to the players as they land on their subsidiary space on the game board. To win, grow your capital while collection the proxy votes to be elected as a director, then buy enough shares to take over control of that company.

This game is a parody of the Fleet Captain’s Gold Hat Championship at Origins. The game reflects the final four rounds, although players could agree ahead of time to play all seven rounds (or any number of rounds). Each player draws opponents and plays various cards on themselves or the other players in an attempt to reach the gold hat before anyone else. The game is intended for 4-6 players and is extremely tongue-in-cheek, concentrating more on the humorous aspects of the game instead of the serious. It is not the intent of the designers or publishers to insult anyone but only to provide an entertaining distraction between four hour long tournament games.

From website:

"Peter Poppo™ and his pals come together in this exciting new game specially designed for emerging readers. Kids and adults alike will love popping the poppers to race to spell words from the 100 colorfully illustrated picture cards.

Your child pops the lettered dice in the poppers and matches them with the word or picture on the card. Being able to rearrange and assemble letters into words in a fast paced setting is challenging and fun. Matching, grouping, and sorting are all skills involved in this challenging fast-paced activity game from Poppo Brands™.

Each round takes up to 60 seconds – perfect for young attention spans – so your kids will love to play again and again."

Ages 4 and up

This board game simulates ski jumping.

Players place their jumper tokens on a ski jumping hill and push them down to let them slide down and eventually "jump". The final score is a combination of the jump length and the "jump style rating" determined by players (they vote using special style scoring cards).

Juego sobre la Batalla del Ebro 1938 de la Guerra Civil Española.
Sistema clásico de hexagonos y fichas a nivel batallon con CRT. Tactico - operacional segun el autor
Incluye 1400 fichas, 4 mapas, rules y libro de escenarios.
Unica realización de la empresa - Vae Victis SCCL.



Game about the battle of the Ebro 1938, in the Spanish Civil War.
Classic wargame with hex and counters. Level Battalion with CRT. Tactic operative scale.
Include 1400 counters, 4 maps and scenery book

The Doctor Who Miniatures Game allows players to recreate the drama of the Doctor's many adventures on the tabletop using miniature figures and scenery. One player takes the side of good, with the Doctor, his companions and some kind of troops (like UNIT soldiers). The other side is generally some dread alien menace seeking to conquer or destroy (Daleks, Cybermen, etc.)

Although weapons play a part in the game, they seldom are the winning factor for the good side. Instead they often rely on the Doctor to invent a device or discover a critical weakness of the aliens, and thereby save the world.

Rules and scenarios from all eras of Doctor Who are available for download from the author's website for free.

Home Page: http://www.drwhominiatures.co.uk/

The Doctor Who Miniatures Game is not the same game as the Warlords Games version; Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game.

item.description:
Ming is an original chess-like strategy game. It is played on a board with 7 x 7 squares. 
Every player has 7 figures (1 emperor, 1 mandarin, 2 generals, 3 monks) that vary in height. In the course of a game, own and opponent's marbles are added to the figures. These define the distance a figure can move and in which way (diagonal or horizontal and vertical).

The game is won in one of three ways:
1) Conquer your opponents emperor;
2) Reach the opponents starting line or
3) Conquer seven marbles of your opponents colour.

from Radio Game Show Games: This early effort predates what are generally considered to be the first game shows. Players drew chips from a bag to determine which word on the host's card they had to spell correctly. Paul Wing was an author and NBC staff director. His show was originally heard only in the cities competing in each weekly broadcast, but the program did eventually (and briefly) gain full network status. Cutting costs even in the 1930s, Milton Bradley's materials for this game were identical to the ones used in Vox Pop.

The game was played by choosing a word caller, then going around the room and having people pull numbered disks out of a bag; the number on the disk determined the word you would spell (and some words were notably easier than others, so it was a bit of a game of chance). Correct moves got you a little green counter called a "honey," and wrong moves got you a little red counter called a "stinger" (because it's a bee, get it?)

PLEASE NOTE: This game description is out-of-date and needs to be updated.

Sturm Europa! is a grand strategic simulation, currently in pre-production, that recreates the entire European conflict during the Second World War. Euro-style wooden pieces are used to depict resources, that depending on placement, represent air, land, and sea units. Each player has a privacy screen that creates "fog of war" by keeping resources and units not on the front line hidden. Sturm Europa! will distinguish itself from other games of the genre in these key areas:

Playability: The entire war, Fall 1939 to the bitter end (Spring 1945 or later), can be played in 6-8 hours. No hexes, no counters, and low luck.

Scale: The map board employs area movement over land regions but the low unit density allows players to realize the full impact of mobile warfare and appreciate the daunting size of Mother Russia without slowing game play unnecessarily. A unique front-reserve combat system allows for operational level details like blitzes, assaults, encirclements, feints, static defense, and defense in depth which are normally lost in grand-strategic simulations.

Units: Units are not only rated by movement, but attrition, assault, and blitz strength. Elite units are created by combat experience, events, and tech research - introducing an extra dimension as units are upgraded and downgraded throughout the war, reflecting varying levels of experience, training, leadership, and technology.

Production: Sturm Europa! goes beyond the standard model of linking military production to a GDP estimate. Nations must mobilize to achieve full wartime production but it takes much more to wage war than just massive production lines. Manpower, oil, steel, and even trained pilots are all tracked without ANY bookkeeping through an innovative system of collecting resources as strategy cards are played. Resources are consumed by prolonged offensives so logistics plays just as much a factor as unit strength.

Strategy Cards: Sturm Europa! is a card driven game (i.e. Paths of Glory). Events introduce historical and political events in a realistic fashion while eliminating scripting and "look up" rules. There is a tangible cause-effect relationship to every event and nothing occurs in a seemingly random or ahistorical manner. Players play the cards - the cards don't play the players. Most importantly, the core mechanic of tough gut wrenching decisions which make CDGs so fun is still preserved.

Technology: Players can customize their units to fight the style of war that best suits their strategy. Germany can develop the He 100 long range fighter that greatly improves their chances in the Battle of Britain. The Americans can develop a heavy-medium tank instead of sending Shermans to get chewed up by King Tigers. Tough decisions will have to be made to implement new technologies though. New designs don't just start rolling off the assembly lines without causing a shortage of replacements on the front line while the factories retool and crews retrain...

TENTATIVE COMPONENT LIST:
(2) large 6-panel mounted maps
(300) wooden resource / unit blocks
(144) 2" double-sided strategy tiles
(84) technology and intel cards
(90) 5/8" punchboard counters
(1) 16-page full color rulebook
(3) player screens
(3) player aids

Can be combined with Operation Orient

item.description:
In Toledo players try to forge magnificent swords and bring them into the fortress of the city, the “Alcazar”.
Each player can send his five helpers on the map and on to the roads of Toledo, in order to acquire steel and jewels from dealers. Thus they get swords manufactured at the most famous armorer in the city. Afterwards those swords are to be delivered to Alcazar.
In addition there are two taverns (at which one “refuels” cards) as well as a place where the works of art of the resident painter, El Greco, are available.
There is a lot to discover in Toledo.

item.description: Players assume the roles of detectives and sit around a 4 person device with 4 phones. Players take turns calling in for clues which are delivered via their personal phone, and some are delivered via all points bulletins over a common speaker. Players record clues on a special playing sheet provided to track individual suspects in mysteries. Mysteries are kept on an "Atari-style" chip that is plugged into the machine. The game comes with one chip of mysteries, and purports to have additional chips available. Like clue with the possibility of individually delivered evidence.

In this game you play the role of a man/woman who wants to fulfill a professional career, selecting a type of character and an objective. You start rolling 2 dice in order to move that number of spaces on the board and get random event drawing cards.
Cards can give you money and other types of fulfillment to reach your goal.
The box contains 6 coloured plastic markers for the players, two wooden dices, a block of sheets to write down your characteristics, a deck of event cards and some "goal card".

From the publisher's website:

Now you can run your own presidential campaign!

Campaign finances, strategic debates and racking up those all important electoral votes could lead you to a stunning victory on the "wild and wacky run for the White House"™!

Choose your home state, begin visiting states to establish campaign headquarters and line up workers until you gain control of a state to receive its electoral votes. Strategically timing debates with other candidates and budgeting your campaign finances while trying to stay out of the spin zone are all part of the fun!

Before the first round is over, you'll know why key states have played important parts in the recent elections and as the last round is played you will have a new appreciation of the total commitment required when striving to gain the electoral votes needed for the U.S. presidency.

Home Page: http://www.theprez.net/

Based on the books by Lauren Child and the television series. Educational and simple board game for 2 to 4 children Ages 3 and up.
Will you be the one to yell "I've Won!" like Lola does? Be the first to reach "I've Won!" in the center of the board after collecting three pink milk cards, but watch out for the tigers who want your pink milk. Comes with game board, 1 die, 4 game pieces with stands and instructions.

From Old Silk Road: A voyager in the game finds himself on the trade routes which existed at the height of the Tang Dynasty in China (c. 750 AD). He sets out from Chang An, the cosmopolitan Chinese capital. Traveling across northern China and then to Central Asia, with a lucky roll of the die he will arrive at Samarkand, an important trading center. There, glass, fruit and horses may be purchased. At Merv, the traveler must decide whether to follow the overland or sea route. Going by sea, one has the opportunity to buy incense at the port of Hormoz, collect rubies, sapphires and pearls in the kingdom of Anuradhapura (now in Sri Lanka), visit the wondrous temples at Elephanta and Kancipuram and buy spices in Srivijaya (Sumatra). But beware! There are mighty perils on this route. On the overland route, the traveler visits magnificent Buddhist temples in India and beyond, encounter tigers in the jungles of Bengal and purchase luxuries such as kingfisher feathers and rhino horn at Angkor. The final leg of the journey passes through the the bustling port of Guangzhou (Canton) and then off to Japan and Korea where the traveler will be able to visit foreign temples and complete final trading before returning home by way of the Grand Canal.

Each location includes a special paragraph of text describing what happens to the traveler there. Often they include special trading opportunities. Major trading centers have specific products which they sell and also another list which they want to purchase. Commodity holdings are shown by cards which list the differing values of these items at various locations. Includes short history and glossary of terms.

link.value: Asian Art Museum of San Francisco

item.description: This game from 1960 consists of two six-sided dice showing heads and tails of elephants and donkeys. Intended as something to encourage people to vote, the game play is similar to put-and-take.

This is John Weber Manufactory's entry into the realm of letter dice games. The game comes with 8 Nu-process letter dice and proudly proclaims the dice are plastic-coated and bear 'official typography'.

The rabbits eat delicious vegetables in the garden. In front of the garden fence they discover big carrots. In the middle of the garden there is a hole. Caution! Don't fall down there! First there is a thin chain that is laid around all players' pawns which are placed around that hole on the board. Each turn the player throws the die and moves as many fields to the outside as the die shows. When a rabbit reaches the chain it is pushed forward in an outside direction while opposite rabbits located in the opposite direction are pushed towards the hole and may fall into it when the thrown die shows enough eyes. The winner is the player who has at least one rabbit left at the end.

Each player on his turn flies with his magnetic honey bee to any bloom and puts the bee on the pollen in the middle of the bloom. He then lifts the bee up carefully. If he is lucky some pollen will keep sticking to the magnet. Then he may immediately fly back and deposit the pollen into the honeycomb. The winner is the player who fills up 5 honeycombs first.

Auto-Scooter at a fair: Each player moves his auto-scooter around the track. He tries to crash into the scooters of the other players and gets "crash points". But has to be careful not caution not to get crashed into from the back.
The winner is the one with the most crash points at the end!

Each player drives a taxi cab that they use to pickup passengers from locations determined by dice rolling to a destination determined by a dice rolling.

Payment is determined by the route taken and the distance traveled.

Intersections can provide an advantage or a disadvantage to each player. Intersections can be clear, have lights or be completely blocked, which changes the route chosen by the players.

Players can also get in each others way.

Fast playing stat summary basketball game. You can get individual player stats for all major stat categories for each game. All NBA seasons from 1954/55-2006/07 seasons. ABA seasons 1966/67-1975/76 coming spring 2008. All games available as Adobe pdf files only and delivered by email. Basic game is instructions, charts and any 2 NBA seasons for $9.95 Paypal preferred. My email address and Paypal ID is rgfray@Yahoo.com. For checks, mail to Bob Fray, 202 Ann St., Phoenixville, Pa 19460. $4.00 extra if you want files on cdrom mailed. For brochure requests, email me - many other original sports games available.

In New World: A Carcassonne Game, players begin as early settlers of the United States on the east coast of the continent. As in the original Carcassonne game, players lay tiles turn by turn to build towns, roads, and other parts of the countryside. A player can choose to place one of his tokens on the tile he lays for the turn, and if that town, road, etc. is completed, then the player scores points and reclaims his token for later use. Whoever scores the most points wins.

One big twist in New World: A Carcassonne Game compared to the original game is that play starts on the east coast, and as players score points, a pair of surveyors drive exploration inexorably westward. Players who do not complete their features before the surveyors pass them by will find their tokens removed from the board - for no points!

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
This is a game where you build 3-D abstract art pieces based on similarities to Pablo Picasso, hence the name. Publisher Fox Spielverlag pitches this as "a stick game with unlimited possibilities." However, there are no "rules" per se. This is more of a "creative expression" product.

Pablo Jr. is actually a 4-part product [1 of 4 boxes is currently represented]. Each "Junior" box contains 25% of the bits contained in Fox Spielverlag's Pablo "big-box" edition.

A light quiz game for 2 - 5 players.

Players have to get 20 points (i.e. 20 rightly answered questions) to win.

name.value: Giochiamo insieme con carta e matita

item.description:
One of the most complete books about paper and pencil games in the world. It contains 101 games among traditional, less known and totally original ones, all to be played with just paper and pencils. Featuring contributions by renown game designers as Spartaco Albertarelli, Domenico Di Giorgio, Alessandro Gatti, Dan Glimne, Beppi Menozzi, Paolo Mori, Water Obert, Pier Giorgio Paglia, Silvano Sorrentino and Andrés Voicu. Rules, variants, history, anecdotes, problems and strategy/tactics notes are included.

In the '90s, a previous Super Sharp Pencil & Paper Games featuring 50 games (39 in the English and Korean editions) appeared.

In 2008 a reduced version for children, with rewriteable boards, has been published by Editoriale Scienza as "Battaglia navale e altri giochi con carta e matita".

In 2016 another reduced edition with 48 games, aimed to families, appeared as "Giochiamo insieme con carta e matita", by Edizioni Sonda.

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
HASTINGS 1066 EIN RITTER SPIEL
Release date: March 2008

Duke William of Normandy has crossed the channel to win the English throne. Harold Godwinson has rushed south to meet him. What follows is a classic battle that will change world history.

In Hasting, two players take on the roles of William and Harold. They command their armies and try to herd their enemy into a killing ground. It is the ultimate game of skill.

Ein Ritter Spiel is a dice-less battle game that allows players to be a general without the danger of real warfare.

Ein Ritter Spiel games come in a box with a 21x16 inch hard board map, an order of battle, laminated rules, and wooden counters.

TYPE: Ein Ritter Spiel – Dice-less War game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: 1 hour
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
SHERLOCK HOLMES AND THE FENIAN MURDERS

Terrorism was nothing new in 19th century England. Irish Fenian rebels plotted violence in England and abroad. Now Sherlock Holmes has been called in to investigate the death of two women at a country estate. It has all the markings of the Fenians. Players make up the clues that Holmes finds. Truth must be revealed.

This is an Engle Matrix Game so each player champions one of the characters of the story. Each turn they buy the right to make up the next clue discovered. This is not automatic though. The player picks another player to decide what their "to happen" roll is. Other players may jump in with counter-arguments forcing a big dice rolling contest. Players try to pin the murder on one another. It never plays the same way twice because people make up different clues each time.

The Fenian Murders uses the same rules as The Case of the Dead Duke. If you like murder mystery then you’ll love this game.

This is an intermediate level Matrix Game. It comes in a box with a 20x15 inch hard board map, character sheet book, rules book, scenario book, wooden counters, plastic gold coins and 2 dice.

TYPE: Intermediate Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: 2 hours
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
COST: $40.00

ARKHAM TERROR: EXPERIMENTAL THERAPY

Patients at Miskatonic State Hospital for the Insane receive state of the art therapy – 1923 state of the art! There is something going on here. The players take on the roles of doctors and patients. Each turn they make up clues that show what is actually going on. After a plot is uncovered they must stop it.

In this Engle Matrix Game players pick a character to champion. Each turn they buy the right to make up what action happens next in the game. Action are not automatic. They pick another player to be their referee. The ref sets the "to happen" roll. Other players may jump in with counter-arguments forcing a dice rolling contest. At first the players uncover(make up) clues that reveal what the evil plot is. One they've created their enemy they work together to save the world... or at least most do. Players can opt to be evil and try and bring the plot to fruition. Since different plots emerge each time the game never plays the same way twice.

Most of the characters are mentally ill but this doesn’t stop them from helping. They were probably saving the world from Lovecraftian monsters before being committed anyway.

This is an intermediate level Matrix Game. It comes in a box with a 20x15 inch hard board map, character sheet booklet, rules booklet, scenario booklet, wooden counters, plastic gold coins, and 2 dice.

TYPE: Intermediate Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 13 to adult
DURATION: 2 hours
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
COST: $40.00

In this game you simply take cards from the pile and ask the question to your neighbour. A simple quiz game with 1000 questions. It is released by two publishers which both have made different questions. However some questions are based on knowledge for which you have to live in the Netherlands.

name.value: Sherlock Holmes: The Hand of Moriarty

item.description:
SHERLOCK HOLMES: THE HAND OF MORIARTY
Release date: May 2008

Sherlock Holmes has tracked Moriarty to a reception marking the opening of a museum of Egyptian Antiquities. He is surprised to meet Irene Adler there as well. The rest of the crowd are highly suspicious. That is when the museum’s benefactor is found murdered and a priceless necklace gone missing. The museum is sealed and Holmes is put on the case.

The Hand of Moriarty is a laminated folio game. It includes a 21x16 inch game map, and a separate set of laminated rules and example of play. The game does not include dice or tokens.

TYPE: Beginner Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 8
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: ½ hour
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High

DR JEKYLL AND MR HYDE

Jekyll and Hyde are locked in a never ending struggle for control. It is not only the control of a real monster – Hyde – but also the hidden monster – Jekyll’s addiction to his drug. The players work to uncover Hyde’s wickedness while also exploring Jekyll’s irresistible urge to let Hyde out. It cannot end well.

This is an Engle Matrix Game so players champion one of the characters of Stevenson's original story. Each turn they pick a question from the game board and answer it. This advances the story but no action is automatic! Players pick another player to be their referee. The ref sets the "to happen" roll. Other players may jump in with counter-arguments forcing a dice rolling contest. Bit by bit events add up to a unique story every time.

Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde is a boxed boardgame. It includes a 20x15 inch game map, a rules book and example of play, and action tokens and a die.

TYPE: Beginner Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 8
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: ½ hour
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
COST: $20.00

name.value: Evil Wizard School: The Final Lesson

item.description:
EVIL WIZARD SCHOOL

The old wizard is near death. Before he dies he will teach his final lesson, the lesson that shows his deepest magic. Whoever receives this lesson will be the next master. The player’s represent the students and faculty of the school. They will scheme and back stab to be the one who gets that lesson. Everyone wants it. This allows you to find out how far they will go to gain power.

Evil Wizard School is built on the idea that wizards are extremely jealous and treat their students like dung. They don’t teach them so they remain weak longer. It is loosely based on what it is like to be in graduate school.

This is an intermediate level Matrix Game. It comes in a box with a 21x16 inch hard board map, character cards, laminated rules, wooden counters and plastic gold coins. It does not include dice.

TYPE: Intermediate Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: 2 hours
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High

name.value: Sherlock Holmes: The Case of the Dead Duke

item.description:
SHERLOCK HOLMES: THE CASE OF THE DEAD DUKE

Sherlock Holmes has been called in to find out who killed Duke Richard. The Duke was unloved by all and found poisoned in his study. The players make up the clues Holmes finds. Clues point to who did it. Players try to pin the murder on one another. Someone has to be guilty.

This is an Engle Matrix Game so players pick a character in the story to champion. Each turn they buy the right to make what action happens next (Like what clue Holmes finds...) Action are not automatic. They pick another player to be their referee. The ref sets the "to happen" roll. Other players may jump in with counter-arguments forcing big dice rolling contests. Bit by bit clues add up until one of he players is arrested. Since players never make up the same clues the game plays differently each time.

The Case of the Dead Duke plays out like an episode of the TV show “Law and Order”. First the players find clues then someone is put on trial.

This is an intermediate level Matrix Game. It comes in a box with a 20x15 inch hard board map of London, character sheet booklet, rules booklet, scenario booklet, wooden counters, plastic gold coins and 2 dice.

TYPE: Intermediate Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: 2 hours
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
COST: $40.00

From the publisher's website:

HP Lovecraft wrote about the reanimation of corpses when my Flapper Grandmother was doing the Charleston with the boy in the band (Grand Dad). In this intermediate level game you take Lovecraft’s start and make your own story. First you find clues that reveal what is going on. Once the plot is outed you make a choice. Am I good or evil? Good guys try to stop plots, evil ones help them succeed. You never know whose side anyone is on till the end game.

If you like Horror Board Games you’ll love this game!

July 2009

Dead Man on Campus is an Engle Matrix Game that allows you to do real time story telling in a boardgame. Each player champions one of the characters at Miskatonic University in 1923. The game host reads an opening hook about how bodies have gone missing from the graveyard. At this point the players take over telling the tale. Each turn a player buys the right to make the next action in the game. They make up a short scene and pick another player to be their referee. The ref sets the "to happen" roll and the player rolls. It either happens and is written down by the players or doesn't. If players like they can buy the right to make a counter-argument to the first players action. A dice rolling contest settles what happens. As you see the rules are very simple but they allow a completely unique game every time.

Players quickly learn how to play - it only takes a turn or two and then never need to look at the rules again. It does take creativity though. If you don't like making stuff up then this is not the game for you but if you do like quick paced back and forth creation then you'll love it.

The boxed board game comes with a hard back board that is color and varnished but I must say that these are hand crafted by the game maker so this is more an art product than a slick made in China game. The game uses wooden counters with stickers but as you wish they can be replaced by metal figures. Cthulhu figures work great!

item.description: The pawn (the player who is courageous enough to cross the robber woods) walks slowly through the forest. When it reaches a field that matches a card that the player has coins are dealt as a reward. The player who has the most valuable coins at the end wins the game.

PARE LOS FACISTS (Stop the Facists) is a simulation on the critical battle also known as the Battle for the La Coruna Road that took place from Jan. 3 to 16th, 1937. In this particular phase of this Nationalist offensive (planned by the German advisers and their Blitzkrieg tech-nique) it was the first time the German Panzers met the Russian T26B tanks. Although their numbers were small both altered their doctrines because of them.

Game Scale: 
Each Day Game Turn represents one day of real time.
Each map hexagon represents 500 yds from side to side.
Each unit counter represents a battalion or company.
Tank units represent 4-5 tanks, each air-craft is a squadron, each AT unit is a battery of 4 guns.

Delicio, the yummy food game

Object of the game: 
The first player to fill his or her plate with a balanced meal wins.

How to play:
Spread all the pieces of "food" out on the table, facedown, around the central board. Each player takes a "plate", which has 8 colored squares on it.

Roll the six-sided die to move around the circular central game board and stop on a colored square. Turn over a card corresponding to that color and place it on your plate.

Each colored space corresponds to a food group. Each food card is identified by a color next to the food.

Red: meat and other protein (e.g. beans)
Yellow: breads and cereals
Green: fruits and vegetables
Blue: dairy products

Plates have one red, one blue, two yellow, and three green squares.

From the back of the box: 
Førstehjelpsspillet er et familiespill som kan spillers med opptil 6 deltakere. Deltakerne skal på tur i Norge, underveis må de løse oppgaver og utføre førstehjelp for å komme videre mot målet. På turen støter de på både behagelige og ubehagelige overraskelser. Riktig besvart førstehjelpsoppgave belønnes med en bit av "Røde Kors-puslespillet" - når en deltaker har puslet et komplett rødt kors må vedkommende inn til vårt hovedkontor i Oslo for å vinne.
...Men det er selvsagt ikke så enkelt...

Th First-Aid Game is a family game for up to 6 players. The players are going on a trip in Norway. During the trip they have to solve tasks and perform first-aid to get to the target. The players will encounter both pleasant and unpleasant surprises. Correctly answered questions rewards you with a piece of the "Red Cross-puzzle." When a player collects all the pieces he or she need to get to our headquarters in Oslo to win.
...But that is of course not that easy...

The game is manufactured by Allservice AS. A company based in Stavanger, Norway that focus on work training 
for unemployed and disabled persons.

The idea of PING PONG is to find correct words in given categories as fast as possible and to drive away the time monster in the opposite direction. If the time monster eats the opposite caterpillar, you earn yourself a point. Each point pushes your own joker forwards on the score list.

name.value: Stone Age: La Edad de Piedra
Stone Age: Találd meg az utad

item.description:
The "Stone Age" times were hard indeed. In their roles as hunters, collectors, farmers, and tool makers, our ancestors worked with their legs and backs straining against wooden plows in the stony earth. Of course, progress did not stop with the wooden plow. People always searched for better tools and more productive plants to make their work more effective.

In Stone Age, the players live in this time, just as our ancestors did. They collect wood, break stone and wash their gold from the river. They trade freely, expand their village and so achieve new levels of civilization. With a balance of luck and planning, the players compete for food in this pre-historic time.

Players use up to ten tribe members each in three phases. In the first phase, players place their men in regions of the board that they think will benefit them, including the hunt, the trading center, or the quarry. In the second phase, the starting player activates each of his staffed areas in whatever sequence he chooses, followed in turn by the other players. In the third phase, players must have enough food available to feed their populations, or they face losing resources or points.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

link.value: Schmuck und Handel (fan expansion for Stone Age)

item.description: Quick, simple miniature rules for armor and infantry combat of the 1950's and 1960's.
Quick, simple miniature wargame rules covering the American revolution to the American Civil War.

ISLAND OF D : THE DUNGEON OF D
A FREE ONE player dungeon-crawling-fun card Game
No bookkeeping, NO DICE, just you, the cards, a token and a dungeon to explore!

1. INTRODUCTION
With the hero's success in destroying the Black Knight's plan in Dawn, it took longer for him to organise his minions. But the time has come at last, the Great War has begun! Backed up by a very strong Dark Magic, he commands a huge army of Greenskins including the fierce Goblorcs, unnatural Beasts, and now the Ice Monsters and even the Undeads have joined his army. The worst part is the Light Sword's new power -- the Black Knight now can heal his minions around him, including himself, in seconds!

Approaching from the west , in a very short time three castles have fallen to his hands, and his armies are swiftly heading to the capital of D. Once again everything seems hopeless and the King of D has called the 18 legendary heroes to gather in the Dungeon of D, deep in the Forest of D to the south, where legend says that centuries ago the Great Wizard of D hid the Amulet of D'eugor. It is believed that only the legendary Amulet of D'eugor can nullify the Light Sword’s power. Unfortunately, the Black Knight knew about this too, so he placed a very strong magical barrier on the entrance to keep anyone from entering.

Luckily, the King has also summoned Daryn and Derek. They can combine their magical abilities to open the barrier for a very short time, allowing just one person to enter the dungeon. But even with their combined power, they can only do this once every three hours. So, one by one the 18 heroes enter the dungeon, hoping to find the Amulet of D'eugor and survive to exit the dungeon. So far no one has returned… and you are hero number 18, the last person to enter the dungeon. Daryn looks into your eyes before you enter the crack in the barrier. "Please, you are our last hope…" You nod a little, then jump in….

2. THE MISSION
Get out of the dungeon alive as rich as you can. And if you are able to, bring the Amulet of D’eugor!!

name.value: Schwerpunkt! Decline and Fall of the German Armour Weapon, East Front 1944-1945

item.description:
Schwerpunkt! is a tactical game of combat on the East Front in the last two years of World War 2. Units are squad-sized, hexes represent about 100 meters across, and game turns are 60 to 120 seconds of real time. Six small scenarios are provided.

The rules are short and succinct, with no real surprises from the standard igo/ugo practice, with one exception ... players alternate, not in taking their full turns, but in initiating combat until all combat is completed, and then in moving until all eligible units have moved. This tends to slow the game down somewhat, but the benefit is the ability of the players to respond to threats in a more timely manner.

The components include four geomorphic map sheets, each 8.5"x11"; six pages of rules; and 166 uncut counters. The production quality is low as the game, as well as the magazine in which it came (more on that in a moment) is photocopied. Photocopied, remember, using 1977 technology.

The magazine is Volume 1 Number 1, and therefore Issue 1, of Combat!, the International Magazine of Conflict Simulations. It's published by Wellington Wargames, also known as Swedish Games Productions, the brainchild of Fredrik Malmberg, who is himself a bit of a prodigal. He began his wargame producing career in earnest when he was 14 years old (see his design 'Fight for Tobruk!') Only 200 copies of The Combat issue 1 were printed.
With much finger skill all players try together to build a tower, as high as possible. The player who gets rid of his pawns first wins the game.

Each player has five lives (bananas).

The first player rolls two dice and say a number. The highest number is always the first. For example: 4 and 5 is 54. The next throws are possible: 31 (lowest), 32, 41, 42, 43, 51, 52, 53, 54, 61, 62, 63, 64, 65, doubles 11, 22, 33, 44, 55, 66 and finally 21 (best throw). Whatever you say, the next player must throw a higher number than you said. You can bluff, and tell a smaller or a higher number. The next player must decide if he believes you or not. If you believe the number, you roll the dice again and gives a higher number. If you say that the player is bluffing, the bluffer must show the dice. If you're right loses the bluffer a banana. If the throw was right, you lose yourself a banana.
When a player said 21, the next player decides if he believes the throw or not. Believing does mean not to look the dice and you lose 1 banana. Are you saying that the thrower is bluffing, then check out the dice. The loser pays 2 bananas.

If during the game you shake the dice and you don’t like the throw, you can shake you again. You may not look that throw and you must give it blind to the other player; and you must say a higher number.
The player can also say "more than enough". If the dice shows a higher number, you can call a low throw. So the next player has the chance to say a higher number without looking at the dice. The poker cup goes quickly around the table, but it could be a bluff.

The winner is the player who’s left with one or more bananas.

The idea of the game is to collect as many musicians as possible. All musicians and the director must have found their places in the orchestra. Each player counts how many musicians he has collected. The player with the biggest orchestra wins the game.
The idea of the game is to guess the combination of the safe with as little tries as possible. After two rounds the winner is the player who cracked the code with the least guess tries.

In order to find hidden treasures in the palace, you must go through many rooms, which are full of strange articles trying to find those treasures. With good memory and some luck the treasures come into sight.
The games' idea is to catch as many number cards as possible. But beware: The number cards may be collected only in the correct order.
The small dog gang is on a bone hunt. The player, who collected three bones with his dog first, wins the round.
The player, who finds the most jewels, becomes new Frog King. Whoever watches well and can memorize much, has a good chance finish the game sitting on the kings' throne.

From the rules:

Five dice spotted 2 to 6, with a fish replacing the 1 spot. the fish on the one spot is a Black Crappie.
The object is to catch the most number of fish.

Players have three rolls of the dice. The player rolls all five dice on his or her first roll, trying to produce a 6. If on the first roll the player gets a 6, the player sets that die aside and scores any fish thrown as part of his or her catch. The player then rolls the remaining four dice two additional times, trying to increase his or her catch of fish.

Each turn is played the same. A player must get a 6 before scoring the catch of fish. If a player does not roll a 6 during his or her three rolls per turn, the player cannot score fish on that turn, and passes the dice.

The player catching the most fish after each player has had three turns, is the winner.

Contains: 5 green fish dice 
 instructions

name.value: Mein erstes Rechenspiel: Wir rechnen von 1 bis 20

item.description: With the number cards and the operational sign cards the player puts a math problem on the table and tries to solve it. If he counted correctly, he receives the math card and throws the die again, in order to push the pawn forward. Whoever reaches the treasure chest in this way first, wins.

When developing tensions break out into open conflict, all of America becomes a war zone as the Government and Rebels clash. The crisis is at hand, but armed conflict is only half the battle because modern wars are also fought on a ‘data’ front of public opinion.

CRISIS 2020 offers players fascinating choices between force and finesse – between striking power and subtlety, as they strive to raise new recruits while converting, neutralizing, and eliminating the opposition using cutting edge ‘Cyberwar’ concepts that are employed by armed forces and insurgents all over the world. And it is the preservation and use of political power, in the form of Crisis Cards, which can make or break an operation.

Should you consolidate regional governments to ensure local control? Call out the National Guard to defend a region and improve its ability as a recruiting ground? Send in an FBI Strike Force to deal with the rabble-rousers and cyber-punks? Suspend elections? Issue an Emergency Decree? Or seek Foreign Intervention from the U.N., South America, Canada, Mexico, or NATO?

Time scale: Each Game Turn equals 4 months 
Unit scale: Military Divisions and Brigades

Game Components:

 One 11" x 17" full color game map
 One 8-page, illustrated, color rules book
 One scenario listing / game setup sheet
 Two player aid sheets
 80 Crisis cards
 120 full-color, mounted, two-sided die-cut game pieces




Reimplements:

 Crisis: 2000




 Buy Microbadge
